sound waves provide missing link
burrows team developed computer models simulate events dying star collapse core supernova explosion
simulations show inner core starts execute pulsations says burrows
show 500 milliseconds core collapses inner core begins vibrate wildly 600 700 800 milliseconds oscillation becomes vigorous sends sound waves
computer runs sound waves actually cause star explode neutrinos
researchers say typical sound frequencies inner core 200 400 hertz audible range around middle c
million steps
new models involve million steps simulate full second core collapse explosion
previous models take account sound waves one fifth number steps simulate first hundred milliseconds core collapse

clues water seepage

effect tiny squeezes porous rock aquifer feeds wells pressurising water held pores forcing regular changes 3 centimetres well water
squeezing subsides well water flows back aquifer
quickly happens depends permeability rock
team noticed every time earthquake occurred permeability jumped surrounding rocks became three times permeable
months tremor rocks relaxed back original state permeability returned normal levels

ion thruster
ion thruster engine propelled cube measured 1 metre across weighed 350 kilograms since launched september 2003
engine type used us craft deep space 1 launched 1998 rendezvous asteroid comet

unlike deep space missions essentially straightline trajectories smart1 carry complex series manoeuvres slowly relentlessly build speed

mathematicians say cake eat youre prepared sums

allows choose slice chocolate icing tradeoff get smaller piece
research based principle surplus procedure published notices american mathematical society
traditional way dividing cake cut choose approach one person cuts cake two chooses half write professor michael jones colleagues montclair state university new jersey
ensures people get sized portion doesnt necessarily mean equally happy
example one may like chocolate icing sprinkles cream
surplus procedure
even researchers propose people tell referee much value certain qualities cake
referee uses weighted values calculate cut cake

nozzle redesign
challenge nozzles
ink typically pooled main reservoir distributed chamber manifold many branching tubes leading nozzle
get uniform drops pressure ink system must precisely regulated maintained delicate task becomes difficult number nozzles size nozzle array increases
overcoming obstacles
jetrix overcomes conventional limitations two ways first main reservoir manifold requires delicate pressure maintenance second limited size fact large piece paper theoretically nozzle every pixel
difference way einat team built printer head turned technology used manufacture computer chips etching printer head silicon wafer chips
instead small array nozzles makes many scans print page design flat 2d panel designed big page eject necessary ink simultaneously
